instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: PM_SYSRST_L  820-3536 nothing above _S5
threads.message:
Hi.

This machine was bought on eBay about a year ago. It's been ultra sonic dirtied with god knows what.
Old gray corroed solder all over.

5V / 3V3_S5 are 5V and 3V3
3V42 is 3V42
Orange / Green OK
PM_SLP_S5_L is low
ADAPTER_EN 3V3
DSW_PWRGD 3V4

I put a new SMC on there as the old one had crap under it.
PM_SYSRST is at 175mV

PPVRTC 3V3

threads.title: PM_SYSRST_L  820-3536 nothing above _S5
threads.message: Could be corrosion everywhere of course :( The common stuff first, U1900,U1950,J6100,U6100 traces and resistors. Check all rails for shorts. Check if 32kHz is coming from U1900 too.
